snippet: The case of a deaf medical student who was denied the use of an interpreter during his clinical training in Omaha, Neb., is to go to trial on Tuesday.
abstract: Case of deaf medical student Michael Argenyi, who was denied an interpreter by Creighton University School of Medicine in Omaha, Neb, during his clinical training, is scheduled to go to trial in Federal District Court in Omaha; is attracting attention of federal government and advocates who are concerned that it could deal a setback to continuing efforts to achieve equality for people with disabilities.
lead_paragraph: The case of a deaf medical student who was denied the use of an interpreter during his clinical training in Omaha, Neb., is to go to trial on Tuesday.

headline.main: Deaf Student, Denied Interpreter by Medical School, Draws Focus of Advocates
headline.print_headline: Deaf Student, Denied Interpreter by Medical School, Draws Focus of Advocates
